pull.title: [Qt] Display txfee in first sendCoinsDialog message box

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

issue.title: display txfee in first sendCoinsDialog message box (issue #1715)
issue.body:
People companying about txfees are not shown in the first question (#1715, #1714) if funds should be sent.
This pull will calculate and include the txfee in the sendcoins question messagebox.

events.body:
I'm following the payment request testplan: https://github.com/gavinandresen/QA/blob/master/PaymentRequestTest.md

"Unsigned payment request"
- OK

"Signed payment request"
- OK

"Signed payment request, multiple addresses"
- Overview is correct, sent transactions are correct
- Strange: no label is added for the second address when doing this. Not sure this is a regression though.

"PaymentACK message"
- OK (paymentack received message displays)

"Expired payment request"
- OK (payment request expired dialog pops up)

events.message:
qt: Display txfee in first sendCoinsDialog message box

events.body: I didn't try to compile, but you can get a looked-at-the-code ACK. We should merge and improve the rest afterwards.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/9e8904f6aeb6e98b4781fcf408b0a2bee550051d for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

issue.title: Ask for password after balance check when sending coins
issue.body:
If user has X bitcoins in encrypted wallet and wants to send them all, and transaction would require fee, here is how
application logic goes right now:
1. Put address and X bitcoins into appropriate fields then click on "Send" button.
2. Confirm send action.
3. Type password and proceed.
4. Bitcoin-qt will complain about not having enough bitcoins to pay fee.

Steps 3. and 4. should be reversed. Additionaly, step where client asks user if he or she is OK with paying extra fee
due to young coins and / or transaction size should come before typing password.

comments.body: This should be changed to dynamic units via `model->getOptionsModel()->getDisplayUnit()`, remember my recent pull :).
I'm not sure if we should use fixed font-sizes.
Is this still used anywhere after this pull?
Yes. We should use that. @laanwj should i takeover again and fix these things?

Hmm... i would keep the current font. Even with fixed font's line breaks are possible.
I also think fixed fonts can look really bad.
I think it's still used when you submit transactions over RPC.
This was also in @jonasschnelli's pull, which I just rebased. We can keep font improvements for a future pull.
@jonasschnelli I'd rather just get this merged ASAP and leave improvements to later. So if there's nothing breaking or obviously incorrect I'd like to get ACKs.
